ygData.subject: RE: RE: Niv's Melody of Preservation
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You guys are reading into the numbers too closely.  Re-axamine them. ... First off, the Effects in spell data file are not absolute values. They are
ygData.messageBody:
> I'd agree if a level 47 person would gain any benefit from a 10 point damage
> shield. That was my question, how often does a level 47+ person ever get
> hit for 10 points or less? Anyone out there who can answer that? As it is
> a 10 pt damage shield would stop pretty much only the 1 pt hits I get. I
> seldom get hit for more than 1 and less than 10. Do hit point shields
> prevent damage from fire shields and the like?

You guys are reading into the numbers too closely. Re-axamine them.

> > Effects: Strength: 10
> > Protective Skin: 10
> > Healing/Damage: 1
> > Max HP: 25

First off, the Effects in spell data file are not absolute values.
They are scalable values. Or are used in some formula. Hymm says
Healing: 1, Anthem says Strength: 5, for example. We all know
Hymm doesn't heal one point, nor does Anthem only give 5 strength.

I will do a little research and repost the info I have found.

Harmonic.
